result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:56 AM Defendant Steven A Moore in court.  Attorney Anna M Kees in court for Steven A Moore.  Attorney Lesli S Boese in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea hearing. 
State places offer on the record. 

State has filed an Amended Information. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of Amended Information and waives reading.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.         
                                     
Court conducts plea colloquy.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Amended Counts 1& 3.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Count 2 is Dismissed and read in. 

Bail remains as fixed.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 09/02/22-- Any further violations of WCS will result in an immediate issuance of a warrant and the Court addressing Bond.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case scheduled for jury status hearing.
Atty Kees advised defendant to appear by zoom to due to circumstances discussed on the record. 
State has no objection.

State advises the court that a witness will not be available for trial.

Court removes case from trial calendar.
Defendant to appear in person for plea and sentencing.

10:44 AM Defendant Steven A Moore in court with attorney Anna M Kees.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Niki Kane, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called to address WCS non-compliance.  
State takes no position, but Defendant needs to comply with WCS. 
Defense requests that court take no action on the bond for reasons as stated on the record.
Defendant is enrolled in treatment.
Defense to provide WCS with treatment information to keep them in the loop.
Court will take no action on the bond at this time.

Defense requests case be set for trial. 
Court will issue a trial scheduling order.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

WCS Court Update Report

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 06/22/22--Court to address at hearing on 6/23.**

to the Court filed by Atty. Anna Kees regarding clerk's email with Court's response and direction regarding WCS non-compliance.  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 6/17/22 - Request denied. This is a felony case for which Mr. Moore is not following his conditions of bond. However, the Court will give Mr. Moore until 2 pm to contact WCS by phone to at least establish contact that way. He must drug test no later than tomorrow morning by 9:00 am. Testing available starting at 7:30. The court will withhold issuance of a warrant until Monday. clerk to advise parties.*

Clerk advised parties by email at 1:25 PM. tb

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 06/16/2022 received and filed.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 06/17/22--The Court expects Mr. Moore to immediately report to WCS for an in-person appointment and drug testing by noon today, 6/17/22. Failure to do so will result in a warrant being issued due to non-compliance with WCS and his conditions of bond. Clerk to notify parties by email and clerk to send a text message reminder advising the defendant of this requirement.**

LF 6/17--advised parties by email and defendant by text per Court's direction.
Hearing on June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

01:02 PM Defendant Steven A Moore in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called to address WCS non-compliance.

Defendant has come into compliance with WCS.
State takes no position on bond.
Court strongly cautions against Defendant missing any future appointments.
Court takes no action on bond.
Court resets next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Bail/bond hearing on May 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:41 AM Attorney Anna M Kees in court.   Defendant Steven A Moore did not appear.   Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Kees has been unable to reach her client to inform him due to the short-notice of the hearing being set. 
Defendant is in treatment. 
State requests capias be imposed and stayed for next hearing.

10:45 AM Defendant Steven A Moore in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Town of Brookfield, police officer, Curtis White sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Boese.  Cross examination by Atty. Kees.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Boese moves for bind over.  Atty. Kees makes closing statements.    Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Anna Kees
Preliminary hearing on May 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant to have no contact with Kimberly M. listed in the Criminal Complaint.    Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 buisness day of being released.

01:57 PM Defendant Steven A Moore in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
